File_Description: Data package level readme. Contains data package summary; acknowledgements; and contact information.
Data dictionary that defines column and row headers across all tabular data files (files ending in ".csv" or ".tsv") in the data package.
Standard: ESS-DIVE FLMD v1; ESS-DIVE CSV v1

File_Description: File-level metadata that lists and describes all of the files contained in the data package.
Standard: ESS-DIVE FLMD v1; ESS-DIVE CSV v1

File_Description: R code to process and analyze daily reach-averaged ecosystem respiration (ERtot) data originally for 356 rivers and streams as described in Appling et al. (2018b; 2018c). This code uses a subset from 208 StreamPULSE sites that has been cleaned and gap-filled (Bernhardt et al. 2022) from the Appling et al. (2018b; 2018c) dataset. This code converts these data from the original areal units (grams oxygen per meter squared per day) to volumetric units (milligrams oxygen per liter per day) for comparison with water column respiration (ERwc) data observed in the Yakima River basin (this study). The output data file is used as an R input data file to Lit_Compare_MML.R to generate descriptive statistics for ERtot and the kernel density plot in Figure 2a.

R code to process sensor replicate data originally given in milligrams oxygen per liter per min to mean stream ecosystem respiration in milligrams oxygen per liter per day and temperature. It also generates Supplementary Information Figure S3. The output data file is used as an R input data file to Lit_Compare_MML.R to compare to ERtot and ERlit and to generate the kernel density plot in Figure 2a. It is also used as an R input data file to RC2_SPS_LASSO_MML.R to perform LASSO regression.

R code to compare literature values of riverine water column respiration and total ecosystem respiration to water column respiration measured in Fulton et al. (2022). It generates Figure 2 and Supplementary  Information Figure S4.
R code to perform Pearson correlations and LASSO regression of water column respiration, geospatial variables, and measured analytes from Grieger et al. (2022). It generates Figure 2b and Figure 4.
R code to create map Figure S1 using site location and water column respiration (ERwc) data from this study and publicly available geospatial data.
R code to generate organic matter (OM) biochemical transformation data using Fourier-transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry (FTICR-MS) data as described in the manuscript.

The first of two R codes to run the Columbia River basin catchment cluster analysis as described in the manuscript. This R code will read the data into R and the user can choose which variable set to use for the cluster analysis performed in the R script 2_ClusterAnalysis.R.

The second of two R codes to run the Columbia River basin catchment cluster analysis to group Columbia River NHDPlusV2.1 catchments into six classes sharing similar characteristics as described in the manuscript. This R code runs the k-means cluster analysis using the normalized data for the variable-statistical moment combinations of 16 key biophysical and hydrological attributes. The input shapefile for this script can be located and downloaded at https://nhdplus.com/NHDPlus/NHDPlusV2_home.php Horizon Systems Corporation 2017. National Hydrography Dataset Plus. This .shp input joins with the results from 1_DataPreparation.R script. The output of this script is not included in the data package but can be generated by running this script.
Text file that describes the two R Scripts and required data files that will allow the user to run the Columbia River basin catchment cluster analysis as described in the manuscript.
Mean water column respiration and temperature for 47  sites across the Yakima River basin, Washington, USA.
Mean areal and  volumetric total ecosystem respiration calculated from 208 sites in Bernhardt et al. (2022). Data was converted to volumetric units using depth from Appling et al. (2018).
QGIS project file for creating Figure 3.
Read me file with links to download data used in scripts.
Shapefile of data from "CB_catchments_clean_joined.*" subsetted to the Yakima River Basin (YRB). The asterisk refers to the file extension (.cpg; .dbf; .prj; .shp; .shx).

Shapefile of the United States used to create Figure 1. Data were downloaded from https://www2.census.gov/geo/tiger/TIGER2021/STATE/.  The asterisk refers to the file extension (.cpg; .dbf; .prj; .qmd; .shp; .shx).

Shapefile of the Yakima River Basin (YRB) boundary. Data were downloaded from https://ecology.wa.gov/research-data/data-resources/geographic-information-systems-gis/data. The asterisk refers to the file extension (.cpg; .dbf; .prj; .qmd; .shp; .shx).
Shapefile of data from "CB_catchments_clean_joined.*" subsetted to the Yakima River Basin (YRB). The asterisk refers to the file extension (.cpg; .dbf; .prj; .shp; .shx).

Shapefile of rivers within the Yakima River Basin (YRB). Data were downloaded from USGS National Hydrography Dataset 2019 (https://www.usgs.gov/national-hydrography/national-hydrography-dataset).  The asterisk refers to the file extension (.cpg; .dbf; .prj; .shp; .shx).

Processed FTICR-MS mass-by-sample data. The first column contains peak masses. The following columns correspond to merged samples generated by merging the data collected from three biological replicates from one site. Each row is associated with a merged peak where higher than zero indicating the peak was observed in at least one out of the three replicates.

R code output data file from Transformation_Analysis_by_Sample_sapply.R. This code performs the organic matter (OM) biogeochemical transformation analysis using Fourier-transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry (FTICR-MS) data as described in the manuscript. The data file contains 1) the total number of OM transformations per site and the 2) the total number of OM transformations normalized by the number of peaks present in the site (i.e. normalized OM transformations).

R code input data file to Transformation_Analysis_by_Sample_sapply.R containing 1) the name or molecular formula and 2) the mass for 1255 commonly observed biochemical transformations. These data are used to calculate the number of organic matter (OM) biochemical transformations using Fourier-transform ion cyclotron resonance mass spectrometry (FTICR-MS) data as described in the manuscript.
Read me file with links to download public data that is used in scripts.

Supplemental table of water column respiration rates from the literature. Also includes columns to convert from the reported units into the units of the data collected. This is the same table that is in the supplemental information; the column headers have been changed and the missing cells have been filled in to ensure machine readability.

R code data input file containing the six cluster centroid values for each variable-statistical moment combination. The k-means clustering algorithm uses these six cluster centroids to group NHDPlusV2.1 catchments in the Columbia River Basin into six classes sharing similar characteristics as described in the manuscript. The centroid values were derived by selecting six classes and letting the k-means converge over 150 iterations.

Shapefile for U.S. Geological Survey National Hydrography Dataset Plus Version 2.1 (NHDPlusV2.1) catchments in the Columbia River Basin as described by the U.S. Geological Survey (2019). The CB_catchments_clean_joined.shp file is the main ArcGIS file and is a direct access variable-record-length file in which each record describes a shape (catchment) with a list of its vertices; the location; and the attributes for all NHDPlusV2.1 catchments (n = 181531) contained within the Columbia River Basin. The asterisk refers to the file extension (.cpg; .dbf; .prj; .sbn; .sbx; .shp; .shx; .xml). Due to the file size of the .shp file it is not included in the GitHub repository but can be located in the ESS-DIVE Data Package.
Figure S3 from the Supplementary Information section of the manuscript showing example triplicate dissolved oxygen and temperature data at two sites.
Figure 1 from the manuscript. This figure shows pictures of the dark bottle incubation and environmental conditions during sampling.

Figure 2 from the manuscript. This figure includes a) kernel density plot of comparisons of literature total and water column respiration to Yakima River basin water column respiration and b) boxplots of individual comparisons of medians from literature water column respiration and Yakima River basin water column respiration.

Figure 3a from the manuscript is a land use/land cover map of the Yakima River basin overlaid with points representing the magnitude or water column respiration at the 47 sites in the Yakima River basin.
Figure 3b from the manuscript is a scatter plot of cube root transformed water column respiration and total drainage area with an ordinary least squares linear regression.
Figure 4 is scatter plots and ordinary least squares linear regressions of cube root transformed variables important in LASSO regression.
Figure S1 from the Supplementary Information section of the manuscript showing the sites on a map of the clusters and variation of water column respiration.
Figure S3 from the Supplementary Information section of the manuscript showing a dot plot of mean water column respiration rates for the triplicate sample incubations performed at each site.

Figure S4 from the Supplementary Information section of the manuscript showing Pearson correlation coefficients, histograms, and scatter plots with ordinary least squares linear regressions of cube root transformed, scaled data variables with positive ERwc values  greater than 0.5 g m-3 d-1 removed and positive ERwc values less than 0.5 g m-3 d-1 turned to 0

Figure S5 from the Supplementary Information section of the manuscript showing Pearson correlation coefficients, histograms, and scatter plots with ordinary least squares linear regressions of cube root transformed, scaled data variables with positive ERwc values less than 0.5 g m-3 d-1 retained
Intermediate map files created in the process of creating Figure 3.
